result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Cruz Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (4th Offense w/in 3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $300.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the fine.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (4th Offense w/in 3Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Cruz Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:58 PM: Defendant Manuel Cruz Martinez in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves a copy of the Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def unsure on whether or not he wants counsel.   Defendant requests to speak directly with the ADA on resolution.  Off record at 3:01 PM:  Back of Record @ 3:07 PM:  Per ADA:  Resolution reached and same recited.  Argued terms on SEH with the State requesting as per guidelines - 20 days WCJ and a fine of $505.00.  Def agrees with State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Def changes his mind and will request counsel.  Court believes based upon earnings that Def will not qualify for SPD services.  He declines Court Appointed counsel and wishes to proceed today.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea No DL 4th:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Argument by ADA as to penalty.  No statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Accepts State's recommendation with slight modification - Imposes 10 days WCJ - Report:  1/8/2016 at 8:00 PM - $505 fine inclusive of costs.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court. Sample to be provided today.  Bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP on balance.   Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Manuel Cruz Martinez
Current: 2105 Division St, Apt #11, Waunakee, WI 53597 United States  (Effective: 12-01-2015)
Prior: 1 Waunona Woods Ct #2, Madison, WI
